citation.article-title: Desulforegula conservatrix gen. nov., sp. nov., a long-chain fatty acid-oxidizing, sulfate-reducing bacterium isolated from sediments of a freshwater lake.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Desulforegula (De.sul.fo.re'gu.la. L. pref. de from; L. n. sulfur sulfur; L. n. fem regula a straight piece of wood or ruler ; N.L. fem. n. Desulforegula a sulfate-reducing bacterium shaped like a ruler)
Cells are Gram-negative, straight rods and can be motile.
Strict anaerobes that use sulfate as a terminal electron acceptor. Desulforegula belongs to the Î´-subclass of the Proteobacteria.
The nearest relatives are Desulfofaba, Desulfobacterium and Desulfonema.
The type species is Desulforegula conservatrix.
